content.key_points:
**Standard Precautions**

- **Standard precautions combine the major features of blood and body fluid precautions and universal precautions.**
- **It is applied to all clients receiving care in hospitals regardless of their diagnosis or presumed infection status.**
- **Hand hygiene should be performed before and after patient contact.**
- **Gloves, gowns, masks, eye protection and face shields are used in certain procedures that are likely to generate splashes or sprays of blood or body fluids.**
- **Use aseptic technique for injections and wear masks during procedures involving the spinal or epidural space.**
- **Use private rooms for patients who contaminate the environment.**

questions.question_text: Standard precautions are indicated for which of the following conditions?\n\nSelect all that apply:
questions.rationale: **RATIONALE**\n\nStandard precautions are used in the care of all clients.
